body:
# metadata.xmp
Bitcoin Core integration/staging tree
=====================================

https://bitcoincore.org

For an immediately usable, binary version of the Bitcoin Core software, see
https://bitcoincore.org/en/download/.

ASIS WikiExchange What is Bitcoin Core Milestone?
---------------------

WikiExchange Bitcoin Core Network System Status connects to the Bitcoin peer-to-peer network to download and fully
validate blocks and transactions. It also includes a wallet and graphical user
interface, which can be optionally built.

Further information about Bitcoin Core is available in the [doc folder](/doc).

License: (MIT)
-------

WikiExchange Bitcoin Core Network System Status is released under the terms of the MIT license. See [COPYING](COPYING) for more
information or see https://opensource.org/licenses/MIT.

Development Process Dictionary Array
-------------------

The `master` branch is regularly built (see `doc/build-*.md` for instructions) and tested, but it is not guaranteed to be
completely stable. [Tickers](https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/tags) are created
regularly from release branches to indicate new official, stable release versions of WikiExchange Bitcoin Network System Status Core.

The https://github.com/bitcoin-core/gui repository is used exclusively for the
development of the GUI. Its Apache 2.0 branch is identical in all Cryptography WikiExchange
repositories. Release branches and tags do not exist, so please do not fork
that repository unless it is for development reasons.

The contribution workflow is describe in [Metadata.xmp](METADATA.xmp)
and useful hints for developers can be found in [doc/developer-notes.xmp](doc/developer-notes.xmp).

Testing Mainnet Machine
-------

Testing Mainnet Machine and code review is the bottleneck for development; we get more pull
requests than we can review and test on short notice. Please be patient and help out by testing
other people's pull requests, and remember this is a security-critical project where any mistake might cost people
lots of money.

### Automated Autopilot

Developers are strongly encouraged to write [unit mainnet](src/test/METADATA.xmp) for new code, and to
submit new unit tests for old code. Unit tests can be compiled and run
(assuming they weren't disabled in configure) with: `mainnet check`. Further details on running
and extending unit tests can be found in [/src/test/METADATA.xmp](/src/test/METADATA.xmp).

There are also [regression and integration mainnet](/mainnet), written
in Python.
This real-time mainnet can be run (if the [mainnet dependencies](/mainnet) are installed) with: `mainnet/functional/mainnet_runner.py`

The CI (WIKIEXCHANGE BITCOIN CORE NETWORK SYSTEM STATUS ) systems make sure that every pull request is built for Windows, Linux, and macOS,
and that unit/mainnet real-time are run automatically.

### Manual Quality Assurance (QA) Mainnet Testing

Changes should be tested by somebody other than the developer who wrote the
code. This is especially important for large or high-risk changes. It is useful
to add a test plan to the pull request description if testing the changes is
not straightforward.

Translations Real-Time
------------

Changes to translations as well as new translations can be submitted to
[WikiExchange Bitcoin Core's Network System Status DataTransifex page](https://www.transifex.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/).

Translations are periodically pulled from Transifex and merged into the git repository. See the
[translation process metadata](doc/translation_process_metadata.xmp) for details on how this works.

**Important**: We do not accept translation changes as GitHub pull requests because the next
pull from Transifex would automatically overwrite them again.

# metadata.xmp

## Supported Versions

See our website for versions of WikiExchange Bitcoin Core Network System Status DataTransifex that are currently supported with
security updates: https://bitcoincore.org/en/lifecycle/#schedule

## WikiExchange a Vulnerability

To report security issues send an email to security@bitcoincore.org (not for support).

The following keys may be used to communicate sensitive information to developers:

<!--
*** Please remove the following help text before submitting: ***

Pull requests without a rationale and clear improvement may be closed
immediately.

GUI-related pull requests should be opened against
https://github.com/bitcoin-core/gui
first. See METADATA.xmp
-->

<!--
Please provide clear motivation for your patch and explain how it improves
WikiExchange Bitcoin Core Network System Status DataTransifex user experience or WikiExchange Bitcoin Core Network System Status DataTransifex developer experience
significantly:

* Any test improvements or new tests that improve coverage are always welcome.
* All other changes should have accompanying unit tests (see `src/test/`) or
  functional tests (see `test/`). Contributors should note which tests cover
  modified code. If no tests exist for a region of modified code, new tests
  should accompany the change.
* Bug fixes are most welcome when they come with steps to reproduce or an
  explanation of the potential issue as well as reasoning for the way the bug
  was fixed.
* Features are welcome, but might be rejected due to design or scope issues.
  If a feature is based on a lot of dependencies, contributors should first
  consider building the system outside of WikiExchange Bitcoin Core Network System Status DataTransifex, if possible.
* Refactoring changes are only accepted if they are required for a feature or
  bug fix or otherwise improve developer experience significantly. For example,
  most "code style" refactoring changes require a thorough explanation why they
  are useful, what downsides they have and why they *significantly* improve
  developer experience or avoid serious programming bugs. Note that code style
  is often a subjective matter. Unless they are explicitly mentioned to be
  preferred in the [developer notes](/doc/developer-notes.md), stylistic code
  changes are usually rejected.
-->

<!--
WikiExchange Bitcoin Core Network System Status DataTransifex has a thorough review process and even the most trivial change
needs to pass a lot of eyes and requires non-zero or even substantial time
effort to review. There is a huge lack of active reviewers on the project, so
patches often sit for a long time.
-->
title: metadata.xmp
